data.name: ksCannotUndoTransducingCitForms
data.value: You cannot use 'Undo' to cancel the effect of this utility. You would need to go back to a previously saved version of the database.

data.name: ksCreatingCustomGramCategory
data.value: You will now be taken to a new, custom grammatical category. Enter at least the name and abbreviation for the new category. Then, click the "Back" button on the toolbar to return to where you were working. The new category will then be available for you to choose.

data.name: ksCreatingCustomLexRefType
data.value: You will now be taken to a new lexical reference type. Enter at least the name and abbreviation for the type. Then, click the "Back" button on the toolbar to return to where you were working. The new type will then be available for you to choose.

data.name: ksCreatingWindowForX
data.value: Creating window for {0} Project...

data.name: ksDemoOfUsingPython
data.value: This is a trivial demonstration of using Python to generate the contents of a field. It is extremely limited. It grabs the default vernacular alternative of the citation form of every entry, runs it through a Python script that you supply, and then places the output in a different writing system alternative of the citation form. It is currently implemented in a very inefficient way; it actually runs the Python script once for every entry in the database. This utility will run the Python script found at (your FieldWorks install directory)\Language Explorer\UserScripts\TransduceCitationForms.py (the supplied sample script will add a Spanish alternative consisting of the default alternative, but with the case of each letter swapped.) Python must be part of your 'PATH' system variable.

data.name: ksShowingSemanticClassification
data.value: This view shows semantic domains that have been used to classify senses, each listing the related senses. You can optionally show all semantic domains, even those that have not been used for any senses.

data.name: kstidOpenSampleDbMsg
data.value:
Do you want to study the training materials for Language Explorer?
If you click Yes, the Sena 3 sample project will open. On the Help menu, point to Training and click Student Manual for a walk-through guide. Alternatively, point to Demo Movies and choose an option. - Play All gives a half-hour overview of Language Explorer. - You may also choose specific demo movie topics.
If you click No, you will see various options for starting work in Language Explorer.
data.comment: note the embedded newlines in this message.

data.name: ksTransduceCitationForms
data.value: Transduce Citation Forms

data.name: ksUsedForSemanticBasedEntry
data.value: This tool is designed for a typist to use during a semantically-based word-collection workshop. For information on this method, see http://www.rapidwords.net

data.name: ksWhenToTransduceCitForms
data.value: This can be used to convert Citation Forms into another writing system.

data.name: CannotFindToolNamed0
data.value: Could not locate the tool named '{0}'.

data.name: ksChartTemplateWarning
data.value: This discourse analysis tool has columns preset for SVO languages. If you need to change that order, edit the list called "Text Constituent Chart Templates". The columns are the 3rd level list items. Note that once you have charted some text, you cannot reorder the columns without first clearing the chart.

data.name: ksNewFeature
data.value: New Feature

data.name: ksUnderDevelopment
data.value: Under Development

data.name: ksUpgradeValidCharsWarning
data.value:
FieldWorks now provides a way for you to specify for each writing system which characters are found in words (word-forming) and which characters are not found in words (punctuation, symbols, spacing).
Before using Text or Concordance tools, we recommend you add word-forming characters so that Language Explorer does not change where it thinks the word boundaries are in your texts. If you use apostrophes, hyphens, zero-width characters, or superscript numbers within words, these should be added and specified as word-forming.
Would you like to do this now?
